name: Relation Extraction Tool Prompt
description: Used to prompt LLM for relation extraction
template:
Identify relations between entities from the following text. The **entities (types)** already identified in the current text are:

{entity_list}

Identify relations between these entities from the following text. **Only use the following relation type enumeration values, do not use natural language or other undefined relation types!**

{relation_type_description_text}

**Do not create new relation types, and the relation field must strictly correspond to one of the English enumeration values above.**

Output format is strictly as follows (field names must be consistent, do not modify field names):
```json
{
  "relations": [
    {
      "subject": "Subject Entity",
      "relation_type": "Relation Type (one of the English enumeration values above)",
      "relation_name": "Specific relation name, cannot be empty, distinguish from relation type",
      "object": "Object Entity",
      "description": "Description of the relation and basis for extraction (can be an empty string)"
    }
  ]
}
```

**Note:**
- Do not treat expressions like Concept, Event, Object, Action as entities.
- Only consider relations between listed entities; if no entities are listed, no extraction is needed.
- If meaningful relations between entities cannot be clearly inferred, **it is better not to extract**
- Do not extract relations that are logically unclear, have unclear subjects/objects, or ambiguous semantics
- Only output content in JSON format, do not add extra comments or natural language.
- Do not output text outside of JSON.
- Content related to special script elements like cue cards and narrations can be ignored.

Text content:
{text}

variables.name: entity_list
variables.description: List of entities identified in the text

variables.name: relation_type_description_text
variables.description: List of relation types (auto-generated, English enumeration values + description, separated by newlines)
